ko: 그 사람 보고를 보면 프로젝트가 잘 진행되고 있는 것 같아요.

en: He has two aunts on his mother's side.
ko: 그 사람은 이모가 두 분 계세요.

en: His mother died when he was young, and his grandmother brought him up.
ko: 그 사람은 어렸을 때 어머니가 돌아가셔서 할머니 손에 컸대요.

en: His mother was more kind than intelligent.
ko: 그분 어머니는 똑똑하기보다 친절한 분이셨어요.

en: It is said that his mother is gravely ill.
ko: 그 사람 어머니가 많이 편찮으시대요.

en: I feel sorry for his mom; he really puts her through the wringer.
ko: 그 사람 어머니가 너무 안됐어요. 걔가 엄마 고생을 진짜 많이 시키거든요.

en: His mother sighed with relief.
ko: 그분 어머니는 안도의 한숨을 내쉬었어요.

en: His mother has been running a drugstore for fifteen years.
ko: 그분 어머니는 15년 동안 약국을 운영해 오셨어요.

en: His mother didn't allow him to ride a motorbike.
ko: 그분 어머니는 걔가 오토바이 타는 걸 허락하지 않으셨어요.

en: His mother had three sons, of whom he was the youngest.
ko: 그분 어머니는 아들이 셋이었는데 걔가 막내였대요.

en: His mother came to pick him up.
ko: 그분 어머니가 데리러 오셨어요.

en: His mother is ill, and is resting.
ko: 어머니가 편찮으셔서 쉬고 계세요.

en: His mother put the money in for him.
ko: 그분 어머니가 걔 대신 돈을 넣어 주셨어요.

en: His mother felt ashamed for him.
ko: 엄마가 걔 때문에 창피해했어.

en: His mother made him clean the bathroom.
ko: 걔네 엄마가 걔한테 화장실 청소 시켰어.

en: His mother compelled him to do his homework.
ko: 걔네 엄마가 걔 억지로 숙제하게 했어.

en: His mother prevented him from going out because she was anxious about his health.
ko: 엄마가 걔 건강 걱정돼서 못 나가게 했어.

en: His mother went mad after the death of her son.
ko: 아들이 죽고 나서 걔네 엄마가 정신이 좀 이상해졌어.

en: His mother is American.
ko: 걔네 엄마 미국 사람이야.

en: His mother looks young for her age.
ko: 걔네 엄마는 나이에 비해 젊어 보여.

en: His pace quickened.
ko: 걔 발걸음이 빨라졌어.

en: The way he walks reminds me very much of his father.
ko: 걔 걷는 게 지 아빠랑 진짜 똑같아.

en: He walks in a stately manner.
ko: 걔는 아주 당당하게 걸어.

en: There are hundreds of books in his study.
ko: 걔 서재에는 책이 수백 권이나 있어.

en: His answer amounts to a refusal.
ko: 걔 대답은 거절이나 마찬가지야.

en: His answer depends on his mood.
ko: 걔 대답은 기분에 따라 달라.

en: His reply was short and to the point.
ko: 걔 대답은 짧고 명확했어.

en: His reply was negative.
ko: 걔 대답은 부정적이었어.

en: His reply is no more than an excuse.
ko: 걔 대답은 그냥 핑계일 뿐이야.

en: His reply was in effect a refusal.
ko: 걔 대답은 사실상 거절이었어.

en: His response was contrary to our expectations.
ko: 걔 반응은 우리 예상과는 딴판이었어.

en: He gave me a flat answer.
ko: 걔는 딱 잘라 말했어.

en: Let me go in place of him.
ko: 걔 대신 내가 가게 해줘.

en: His strange habit confounded them.
ko: 걔의 이상한 습관 때문에 사람들이 다 당황했어.

en: His cottage is neat and comfortable; moreover, it can accommodate as many as ten people.
ko: 걔네 별장은 깔끔하고 아늑해. 게다가 열 명까지도 묵을 수 있어.

en: His calmness is more apparent than real.
ko: 걔는 겉으로는 침착해 보이지만 실제로는 아냐.

en: He always listens to serious music.
ko: 걔는 항상 진지한 음악만 들어.

en: His writing is very subjective.
ko: 걔 글은 아주 주관적이야.

en: His indignation got the better of him.
ko: 걔는 화를 참지 못했어.

en: His story was interesting.
ko: 걔 이야기는 재밌었어.

en: His right-hand man gave him away and got in his way to the top.
ko: 걔 심복이 걔를 배신하고 출셋길을 막았어.

en: His notion of welfare is pretty abstract.
ko: 걔가 생각하는 복지 개념은 꽤 추상적이야.

en: His dress betrayed the fact that he was a foreigner.
ko: 옷차림만 봐도 걔가 외국인인 게 딱 티 났어.

en: His clothes are always out of style.
ko: 걔 옷은 항상 유행에 뒤떨어져.

en: His clothes didn't match his age.
ko: 걔 옷차림은 나이에 안 맞아.

en: His clothes are out of fashion.
ko: 걔 옷은 유행이 지났어.

en: His clothes always smell bad.
ko: 걔 옷에선 항상 냄새가 나.

en: His clothes were dripping.
ko: 걔 옷에서 물이 뚝뚝 떨어지고 있었어.

en: Nobody can help laughing at his eccentric behavior.
ko: 걔의 별난 행동을 보면 다들 웃지 않을 수 없어.

en: His room was brightly lit.
ko: 걔 방은 불이 환하게 켜져 있었어.

en: His room is anything but neat.
ko: 걔 방은 전혀 깨끗하지 않아.

en: His room is twice as large as mine.
ko: 걔 방은 내 방보다 두 배나 커.

en: His room was in disorder.
ko: 걔 방은 엉망진창이었어.

en: His room is untidy.
ko: 걔 방은 지저분해.

en: His room was covered with dust.
ko: 걔 방은 먼지투성이였어.

en: His room is always out of order.
ko: 걔 방은 항상 어질러져 있어.

en: His room is always filled with his friends.
ko: 걔 방은 항상 친구들로 북적거려.

en: His room is always a tip.
ko: 걔 방은 항상 엉망이야.

en: His room is always in good order.
ko: 걔 방은 항상 잘 정리되어 있어.

en: His room is always tidy.
ko: 걔 방은 항상 깔끔해.

en: His untidy room announced that he had abruptly departed.
ko: 어질러진 방을 보니 걔가 갑자기 나간 것 같았어.

en: Since the light in his room is on, he must have come home.
ko: 방에 불이 켜진 거 보니 걔 집에 왔나 봐.

en: I'll show you to his office and introduce you to him.
ko: 걔 사무실로 안내해서 소개해주고 인사시켜 줄게.

en: There was nothing but a desk in his room.
ko: 걔 방엔 책상밖에 없었어.

en: There is a lot of furniture in his room.
ko: 걔 방에 가구가 진짜 많아.

en: There are a lot of books in his room.
ko: 걔 방엔 책이 엄청 많아.

en: I had to swallow his insult.
ko: 걔가 모욕하는 걸 그냥 참아야만 했어.

en: I relieved him of his burden.
ko: 내가 걔 짐을 좀 덜어줬어.

en: It is estimated that his debts will amount to a considerable sum.
ko: 걔 빚이 꽤 될 거로 보인대.

en: His wounded leg began to bleed again.
ko: 걔 다친 다리에서 다시 피가 나기 시작했어.

en: His debts amount to more than he can pay.
ko: 걔 빚이 갚을 수 있는 수준을 넘었어.

en: All his injuries are external.
ko: 걔 부상은 다 겉에만 그래.

en: His injuries are all external.
ko: 걔 부상은 전부 겉에만 입은 거야.

en: His father approved of his plan.
ko: 걔네 아빠가 걔 계획 찬성하셨어.

en: His father got records of bird songs for him.
ko: 걔네 아빠가 걔한테 새소리 녹음된 걸 구해주셨어.

en: His father had a good influence on him.
ko: 걔네 아빠가 걔한테 좋은 영향을 주셨어.

en: His father had died of cancer 10 years ago.
ko: 걔네 아빠는 10년 전에 암으로 돌아가셨어.

en: The man who I thought was his father proved to be a perfect stranger.
ko: 걔네 아빠인 줄 알았던 사람이 알고 보니 생판 남이었어.

en: Both his father and mother are dead.
ko: 걔네 부모님 두 분 다 돌아가셨어.

en: His father brought him up to be a doctor.
ko: 걔네 아빠가 걔를 의사로 키우셨어.

en: It seems that his father is a lawyer.
ko: 걔네 아빠 변호사인가 봐.

en: His father failed in business.
ko: 걔네 아빠 사업 망하셨어.

en: His father breathed his last this morning.
ko: 걔네 아버님 오늘 아침에 돌아가셨어.

en: His father administers some companies.
ko: 걔네 아빠가 회사 몇 개 운영하셔.

en: Is his father a doctor?
ko: 걔네 아빠 의사야?

en: His father always comes home late.
ko: 걔네 아빠는 맨날 늦게 들어오셔.

en: His father eats there twice a week.
ko: 걔네 아빠 일주일에 두 번 거기서 식사하셔.

en: His father consented to my plan against his will.
ko: 걔네 아빠가 내키지 않아 하면서도 내 계획에 동의하셨어.

en: With his father's help, he would have succeeded in this task sooner.
ko: 아빠가 도와주셨으면 걔가 이 일을 더 빨리 끝냈을 텐데.

en: His father died, and to make matters worse, his mother fell ill.
ko: 아버지가 돌아가셨는데 설상가상으로 어머니까지 편찮아지셨어.

en: He failed in the scheme, much to the disappointment of his father.
ko: 걔가 그 계획을 망쳐서 아버지가 엄청 실망하셨어.

en: He owes his wealth to good luck.
ko: 걔가 부자가 된 건 운 덕분이야.

en: Her husband has been in prison for three years.
ko: 걔 남편 지금 3년째 감옥에 있어.

en: His carelessness resulted in the accident.
ko: 걔가 부주의해서 사고가 났어.

en: The accident happened because he wasn't careful.
ko: 걔가 조심하지 않아서 사고가 난 거야.

en: I refuse to put up with his carelessness any longer.
ko: 걔 부주의한 거 이제 더 이상 못 참아.

en: I was amazed at his carelessness.
ko: 걔가 너무 부주의해서 깜짝 놀랐어.

en: His careless driving caused the accident.
ko: 걔가 운전을 부주의하게 해서 사고가 났어.

en: No attention was paid to his warning.
ko: 아무도 걔 경고를 신경 쓰지 않았어.

en: The explosion took place because of his carelessness.
ko: 걔가 부주의해서 폭발 사고가 났어.

en: His carelessness resulted in an accident.
ko: 걔 부주의 때문에 사고가 났어.

en: His carelessness brought about the accident.
ko: 걔가 부주의해서 사고를 일으켰어.

en: I expostulated with him on his dishonesty.
ko: 난 걔가 정직하지 못한 거에 대해 따졌어.

en: His unkindness made her angry.
ko: 걔가 불친절해서 그 여자애가 화났어.

en: Everything chose to go wrong during his absence.
ko: 걔가 없는 동안 모든 일이 꼬여버렸어.

en: His unhappy childhood affected his outlook on life.
ko: 불우했던 어린 시절이 걔 가치관에 영향을 줬어.

en: I'm tired of all his complaints.
ko: 걔 불평불만 듣는 거 이제 지긋지긋해.

en: His irreligious statements are offensive.
ko: 걔가 종교에 대해 함부로 말하는 거 진짜 불쾌해.

en: His conduct is open to grave objection.
ko: 걔 행동은 정말 문제가 많아.

en: His condition changed for the better.
ko: 걔 상태가 좀 좋아졌어.

en: His condition will soon change for the better.
ko: 걔 상태 곧 좋아질 거야.

en: His ill health interfered with his research.
ko: 걔 건강이 안 좋아서 연구에 지장이 생겼어.

en: Nobody expected that his condition would take a sudden turn.
ko: 걔 상태가 갑자기 나빠질 줄은 아무도 몰랐어.

en: His illness is one of her chief anxieties.
ko: 그 사람이 아픈 게 그 여자분한텐 가장 큰 걱정거리 중 하나야.

en: His illness stems from his intemperance.
ko: 그 사람 병은 무절제한 생활 때문에 생긴 거야.

en: His illness is critical.
ko: 그 사람 상태가 아주 위중해.

en: His illness resulted from eating too much.
ko: 그 사람 너무 많이 먹어서 병난 거야.

en: He is slowly recovering from his illness.
ko: 그 사람 병이 조금씩 나아지고 있어.

en: His trouble was chiefly mental.
ko: 그 사람 문제는 주로 정신적인 거였어.

en: His illness was mainly psychological.
ko: 그 사람 병은 주로 심리적인 요인이 컸어.

en: His illness is one of my anxieties.
ko: 그 사람이 아픈 게 내 걱정거리 중 하나야.

en: His illness resulted from drinking too much.
ko: 그 사람 술을 너무 많이 마셔서 병난 거야.

en: His illness may be cancer.
ko: 그 사람 병, 어쩌면 암일지도 몰라.

en: His illness comes of drinking too much.
ko: 술을 너무 많이 마신 게 병의 원인이야.

en: If I'd known about his illness, I would've visited him in the hospital.
ko: 그 사람이 아픈 걸 알았더라면 병문안을 갔을 거야.

en: The medical name for his disease is ALS.
ko: 그 사람 병의 의학적 명칭은 루게릭병이야.

en: His illness caused her great misery.
ko: 그 사람이 아파서 그 여자가 정말 괴로워했어.

en: His painting wasn't particularly good, so no one praised him for it.
ko: 그 사람 그림이 딱히 훌륭하진 않아서 아무도 칭찬 안 해줬어.

en: The painting he'd painted wasn't very good so nobody praised it.
ko: 그 사람이 그린 그림이 별로여서 아무도 칭찬을 안 했어.

en: His comment was concise and to the point.
ko: 그 사람 말은 간결하고 핵심을 잘 짚었어.

en: He got a bad reputation.
ko: 그 사람 평판이 나빠졌어.

en: His criticisms were highly esteemed.
ko: 그 사람 비판은 높게 평가받았어.

en: There was fear on his face.
ko: 그 사람 얼굴에 두려움이 가득했어.

en: There was fear in his eyes.
ko: 그 사람 눈에 두려움이 서려 있었어.

en: He had a severe look on his face.
ko: 그 사람 표정이 아주 엄해 보였어.

en: The look on his face was next door to hatred.
ko: 그 사람 표정은 거의 증오에 가까웠어.

en: Judging from his expression, he is not telling the truth.
ko: 표정을 보니까 그 사람 거짓말하는 것 같아.

en: I gathered from his expression that he was very angry.
ko: 표정을 보니 그 사람 엄청 화난 것 같더라고.

en: Judging from his expression, he is in a bad mood.
ko: 표정을 보아하니 기분이 안 좋은 것 같아.

en: His voting record is riddled with contradictions.
ko: 그 사람 투표 기록을 보면 모순투성이야.

en: His handwriting is very poor, I cannot make head or tail of it.
ko: 그 사람 글씨가 너무 엉망이라 도통 뭐라고 썼는지 모르겠어.

en: His knowledge of art is poor.
ko: 그 사람은 예술에 대해서 잘 몰라.

en: I was taken in by his good looks and gracious manners.
ko: 그 사람 잘생긴 외모랑 매너에 홀딱 넘어갔어.

en: His smile put her at ease.
ko: 그 사람의 미소가 그 여자를 안심시켰어.

en: His airplane crashed in the mountains.
ko: 그 사람이 탄 비행기가 산에 추락했어.

en: His plane has not arrived at the airport yet.
ko: 그 사람이 타고 올 비행기가 아직 공항에 도착 안 했어.

en: Do you know the time of arrival of his plane?
ko: 그 사람 비행기가 언제 도착하는지 알아?

en: When his wife heard of his violent death, she was beside herself with grief.
ko: 남편의 비참한 죽음을 전해 듣고 아내는 제정신이 아닐 정도로 슬퍼했어.

en: His secret will be disclosed soon.
ko: 그 사람 비밀은 곧 드러날 거야.

en: His secret life came to light at last.
ko: 그 사람의 비밀스러운 사생활이 결국 탄로 났어.

en: His secretary seems to know the truth.
ko: 그 사람 비서가 진실을 알고 있는 것 같아.

en: His secretary denied leaking out the information.
ko: 그 사람 비서가 정보를 유출했다는 걸 부인했어.

en: His secretary can speak three languages well.
ko: 그 사람 비서는 3개 국어를 유창하게 해.

en: His secretary greeted me.
ko: 그 사람 비서가 나를 맞아줬어.

en: His secretary flatly denied leaking any confidential information.
ko: 그 사람 비서가 기밀 정보를 유출한 사실을 딱 잘라 부인했어.

en: His ironical remarks are not directed at you.
ko: 그 사람의 비꼬는 말은 너 들으라고 하는 소리 아니야.

en: His ironical remarks aren't directed at you.
ko: 그 사람의 비꼬는 말은 널 겨냥한 게 아니야.

en: His remark put me out of countenance.
ko: 그 사람 말 때문에 당황해서 어쩔 줄 몰랐어.

en: His comment hit below the belt.
ko: 그 사람 말은 정말 비겁했어.

en: His criticisms were very severe.
ko: 그 사람 비판은 아주 혹독했어.

en: His criticisms were aimed at the Japanese government.

ko: 걔가 입을 다문 건 사실상 죄를 인정한 거나 마찬가지였어.

en: What does his silence imply?
ko: 걔가 아무 말도 안 하는 게 뭘 의미하는 걸까?

en: His long speech bored everyone.
ko: 걔 연설이 너무 길어서 다들 지루해했어.

en: I got bored with his long talk.
ko: 걔 이야기가 너무 길어서 지루해졌어.

en: I'm fed up with his long talks.
ko: 걔의 긴 이야기는 이제 아주 질렸어.

en: The desire he has had for years has been fulfilled.
ko: 그가 몇 년 동안 바랐던 소망이 이루어졌어.

en: He bored us with his long stories.
ko: 그는 긴 이야기로 우리를 지루하게 만들었어.

en: I was tired of his long talk.
ko: 걔 이야기가 너무 길어서 지쳤어.

en: I am sick of his long speech.
ko: 걔 연설은 이제 지긋지긋해.

en: I am through with his long speech.
ko: 걔 연설은 이제 질렸어.

en: I am tired of listening to his long speech.
ko: 걔의 긴 연설을 듣는 것도 이젠 지겨워.

en: His long speech bored us all.
ko: 걔의 긴 연설은 우리 모두를 지루하게 했어.

en: His savings will soon amount to one million yen.
ko: 걔가 저금한 게 곧 백만 엔이 될 거야.

en: The data presented in his book are not based on scientific observations.
ko: 걔 책에 나온 데이터는 과학적인 관찰에 근거한 게 아니야.

en: His book became an object of criticism.
ko: 걔 책은 비판의 대상이 됐어.

en: Don't make light of his advice.
ko: 걔 조언을 가볍게 여기지 마.

en: Bear his advice in mind.
ko: 걔 조언을 명심해.

en: Why don't you listen to his advice?
ko: 걔 조언 좀 듣지 그래?

en: His advice was very helpful.
ko: 걔 조언이 정말 도움이 됐어.

en: His advice would be very useful to you.
ko: 걔 조언이 너한테 정말 유용할 거야.

en: His advice is always very sensible.
ko: 걔 조언은 항상 정말 현명해.

en: His advice counted for little.
ko: 걔 조언은 별로 소용이 없었어.

en: His advice didn't help much.
ko: 걔 조언이 별 도움이 안 됐어.

en: Thanks to his advice, I succeeded in the examination.
ko: 걔 조언 덕분에 시험에 합격했어.

en: Thanks to his advice, I have saved a lot of money.
ko: 걔 조언 덕분에 돈을 많이 아꼈어.

en: In accordance with his advice, I called off the deal.
ko: 걔 조언대로 거래를 취소했어.

en: According to his advice, I decided it.
ko: 걔 조언에 따라 결정했어.

en: His advice came home to me.
ko: 걔 조언이 가슴에 깊이 와닿았어.

en: His advice touched me to the quick.
ko: 걔 조언이 내 정곡을 찔렀어.

en: If it had not been for his advice, she would not have flown to London.
ko: 걔 조언이 없었다면 그녀는 런던에 가지 않았을 거야.

en: Obviously, his companions were jealous of his wealth.
ko: 분명 걔 동료들은 걔 재산을 질투했을 거야.

en: His delay admits of no excuse.
ko: 늦은 건 변명의 여지가 없어.

en: There's no excuse for his delay.
ko: 늦은 데 대해서는 변명의 여지가 없어.

en: His knowledge of geography is poor.
ko: 걔는 지리를 진짜 몰라.

en: His mental level is higher than the average boy's.
ko: 걔는 또래 애들보다 정신 연령이 높아.

en: His acquaintance runs a grocery in the country.
ko: 걔 아는 사람이 시골에서 식료품점을 해.

en: His acquaintance runs a general store in the countryside.
ko: 걔 지인이 시골에서 잡화점을 운영해.

en: His term of office as governor expires next January.
ko: 그 사람 도지사 임기가 내년 1월에 끝나.

en: I was fortunate to make his acquaintance.
ko: 그 사람을 알게 돼서 참 다행이야.

en: His birthday just happens to be the same as mine.
ko: 걔 생일이 마침 나랑 똑같아.

en: His birthday is August 21st.
ko: 걔 생일 8월 21일이야.

en: I am at a loss what to buy him for his birthday.
ko: 걔 생일 선물로 뭘 사야 할지 모르겠어.

en: I don't know what to buy him for his birthday.
ko: 걔 생일 선물로 뭐 사줄지 고민이야.

en: On his birthday, I took a train to the town in which he lived.
ko: 걔 생일날, 걔가 사는 동네로 가는 기차를 탔어.

en: I almost forgot that it was his birthday.
ko: 걔 생일인 거 하마터면 잊어버릴 뻔했어.

en: His birthday party is to be held at three tomorrow.
ko: 걔 생일 파티 내일 3시에 한대.

en: He has an uncontrollable temper.
ko: 걔는 성질머리가 장난 아니야.

en: Sailing a boat, his chief hobby, costs him most of his salary.
ko: 걔는 주 취미인 보트 타는 데 월급을 거의 다 써.

en: His ambition is to be a lawyer.
ko: 걔 꿈은 변호사가 되는 거야.

en: His ambition was to be a great politician.
ko: 걔 야망은 훌륭한 정치인이 되는 거였어.

en: He is always talking big.
ko: 걔는 항상 허풍을 떨어.

en: Thanks to his bold decision, he was able to ride out the crisis.
ko: 걔의 과감한 결정 덕분에 위기를 넘길 수 있었어.

en: His bold plan gave rise to much controversy.
ko: 걔의 대담한 계획 때문에 논란이 많았어.

en: The partner was discouraged to his large victory.
ko: 걔가 크게 이기니까 파트너가 기가 죽었어.

en: His rival was discouraged by his triumph.
ko: 걔가 우승하니까 라이벌이 의욕을 잃었어.

en: His college boasts the finest view in the city.
ko: 걔네 대학교는 도시에서 전망이 제일 좋기로 유명해.

en: His loud voice drew my attention.
ko: 걔 목소리가 너무 커서 눈길이 갔어.

en: How big is he?
ko: 걔 덩치가 얼마나 커?

en: His speech irritates me.
ko: 걔 말하는 게 짜증 나.

en: You should imitate his behavior.
ko: 걔 행동을 좀 본받아봐.

en: What do you think of his attitude?
ko: 걔 태도에 대해서 어떻게 생각해?

en: He is impolite, not to say rude.
ko: 걔는 무례하다 못해 예의가 없어.

en: His behavior is significant of his intentions.
ko: 걔 행동을 보면 속셈을 알 수 있어.

en: His manners aren't those of a gentleman.
ko: 걔 매너는 신사답지 못해.

en: His attitude is by no means polite.
ko: 걔 태도는 전혀 예의 바르지 않아.

en: His bearing was stiff and military.
ko: 걔 태도가 군인처럼 뻣뻣했어.

en: His manners were anything but pleasant.
ko: 걔 매너는 불쾌하기 짝이 없었어.

en: His manner to us was kind.
ko: 걔는 우리한테 친절하게 대했어.

en: He is very blunt in his manner.
ko: 걔는 말투가 엄청 직설적이야.

en: He has turned 180 degrees around.
ko: 걔 완전히 딴사람이 됐어.

en: He changed his attitude by 180 degrees.
ko: 걔 태도가 180도 바뀌었어.

en: I don't have a problem with his attitude.
ko: 난 걔 태도에 불만 없어.

en: There is nothing of the banker in his bearing.
ko: 걔 모습에서 은행원 같은 구석은 전혀 찾아볼 수 없어.

en: His behavior is above suspicion.
ko: 걔 행동은 의심할 여지가 없어.

en: He's shown no appreciable change of attitude.
ko: 걔는 태도가 눈에 띄게 변한 게 없어.

en: His manner partakes of insolence.
ko: 걔 태도에는 무례한 구석이 있어.

en: His attitude disgusts me.
ko: 걔 태도 진짜 정떨어져.

en: His behavior alienated his friends.
ko: 걔 행동 때문에 친구들이 다 떠나갔어.

en: His manner marks him as a provincial.
ko: 걔 말투를 보니 시골 사람인 게 티가 나네.

en: His laziness boded ill for the future.
ko: 걔가 그렇게 게을러서야 앞날이 뻔해 보였어.

en: I cannot put up with his idleness any longer.
ko: 걔의 게으름을 더는 못 봐주겠어.

en: His idleness resulted in the failure, and with reason.
ko: 걔가 게을러서 결국 실패한 건데, 그럴 만했어.

en: His laziness is past the margin of endurance.
ko: 걔 게으름은 진짜 못 봐줄 정도야.

en: I can't excuse his laziness.
ko: 걔 게으른 건 도저히 봐줄 수가 없어.

en: I'm at a loss for what to do with him. He's so lazy.
ko: 너무 게을러서 걔를 대체 어쩌면 좋을지 모르겠어.

en: His powers are failing.
ko: 걔 기운이 예전만 못해.

en: His strength slowly declined.
ko: 걔 기력이 점점 떨어졌어.

en: His strength is waning.
ko: 걔 힘이 다 빠져가고 있어.

en: His weight is double what it was ten years ago.
ko: 걔 몸무게가 10년 전보다 두 배나 늘었어.

en: His temperature is normal.
ko: 걔 체온은 정상이야.

en: He was burning with fever.
ko: 걔 열이 펄펄 끓었어.

en: His body shivered with excitement.
ko: 걔는 흥분해서 몸을 떨었어.

en: His body showed every mark of his strength.
ko: 걔 몸을 보니까 힘이 넘치는 게 딱 보이더라.

en: He batted .343 with 54 home runs.
ko: 걔 타율 3할 4푼 3리에 홈런 54개나 쳤어.

en: I can't put up with the way he spits.
ko: 걔 침 뱉는 거 진짜 못 참겠어.

en: His broad interests bring him broad views on everything.
ko: 걔는 관심사가 넓어서 그런지 세상을 보는 눈이 넓어.

en: His large income enables him to travel abroad every year.
ko: 걔는 수입이 많아서 매년 해외여행을 가.

en: His large income makes it possible for him to travel overseas every year.
ko: 걔는 돈을 많이 벌어서 매년 외국으로 여행 다닐 수 있어.

en: Unlike his other writings, this book was not for scientists.
ko: 걔의 다른 글들이랑 다르게 이 책은 과학자들을 위한 게 아니었어.

en: His existence was recognized.
ko: 걔 존재가 인정받았어.

en: His thesis is related to mine.
ko: 걔 논문이 내 거랑 관련이 있어.

en: His sleeve touched the greasy pan.
ko: 걔 소매가 기름기 있는 팬에 닿았어.

en: His leg was bitten by a crocodile.
ko: 걔 다리를 악어한테 물렸어.

en: His leg was in critical condition, but fortunately it got better.
ko: 걔 다리 상태가 심각했는데 다행히 좋아졌어.

en: Neither of his sons wants to succeed to his family business.
ko: 걔 아들들 둘 다 가업을 잇고 싶어 하지 않아.

en: His son wants to be a lawyer.
ko: 걔 아들은 변호사가 되고 싶어 해.

en: His son is serving his sentence.
ko: 걔 아들은 지금 복역 중이야.

en: His son was lost in the town.
ko: 걔 아들이 동네에서 길을 잃었어.

en: His son is lazy and good for nothing.
ko: 걔 아들은 게으르고 아무짝에도 쓸모가 없어.

en: His son cannot so much as write his own name.
ko: 걔 아들은 제 이름도 못 써.

en: His son is in college now.
ko: 걔 아들은 이제 대학생이야.

en: His son trembled with fear.
ko: 걔 아들은 무서워서 벌벌 떨었어.

en: His son fell over the cliff.
ko: 걔 아들이 절벽에서 떨어졌어.

en: His son became a great scientist.
ko: 걔 아들은 훌륭한 과학자가 됐어.

en: What has become of his son?
ko: 걔 아들은 어떻게 됐어?

en: His son is eight years old.
ko: 걔 아들은 여덟 살이야.

en: His sons are not properly brought up.
ko: 걔 아들들은 교육을 제대로 못 받았어.

en: There is no doubt that his sons are good boys.
ko: 걔 아들들이 착한 애들이라는 건 의심할 여지가 없어.

en: His daughter, as well as his son, was famous.
ko: 아들뿐만 아니라 걔 딸도 유명했어.

en: Not only his son, but his daughter is also famous.
ko: 걔 아들뿐만 아니라 딸도 유명해.

en: His son became a famous pianist.
ko: 걔 아들은 유명한 피아니스트가 됐어.

en: The news of his son's death was a great shock.
ko: 아들이 죽었다는 소식은 큰 충격이었어.

en: His son took on the management of the factory.
ko: 걔 아들이 공장 경영을 맡았어.

en: His present is a bottle of wine.
ko: 걔 선물은 와인 한 병이야.

en: I feel bad about not having gone to his funeral.
ko: 걔 장례식에 못 가서 마음이 안 좋아.

en: A great many people attended his funeral.
ko: 걔 장례식에 사람들이 정말 많이 왔어.

en: I didn't attend his funeral.
ko: 나 걔 장례식에 안 갔어.

en: I can't tell his twin sisters apart.
ko: 걔네 쌍둥이 자매는 누가 누군지 구분이 안 돼.

en: His crude jokes made Jane angry.
ko: 걔의 저질스러운 농담 때문에 제인이 화났어.

en: His grandfather is still very healthy for his age.
ko: 걔네 할아버지는 연세에 비해서 아직 정말 건강하셔.

en: His grandfather lives on an allowance from his son.
ko: 걔네 할아버지는 아들이 주는 용돈으로 생활하셔.

en: His grandfather passed away peacefully.
ko: 할아버지는 편안하게 돌아가셨어.

en: His grandfather was a soldier of high degree.
ko: 그분 할아버지는 고위 장교였대.

en: Both his grandfathers are dead.
ko: 양쪽 할아버지 두 분 다 돌아가셨어.

en: He must have been named after his grandfather.
ko: 할아버지 이름을 따서 이름을 지었나 봐.

en: All his energies were devoted to the experiment.
ko: 그 사람은 실험에 모든 에너지를 쏟았어.

en: Investing all his fortune would not be enough.
ko: 전 재산을 다 투자해도 모자랄 거야.

en: His good nature seems to fulfill the role of reducing the family's trouble.
ko: 그 사람 성격이 좋아서 집안의 걱정을 덜어주는 것 같아.

en: We made inquiries into his past.
ko: 그 사람 과거에 대해서 좀 알아봤어.

en: A great future is reserved for him.
ko: 그 사람 앞날은 정말 탄탄대로일 거야.

en: His prospects are not so rosy as you suppose.
ko: 그 사람 전망이 네 생각만큼 그렇게 밝지는 않아.

en: There was not a ray of hope before him.
ko: 그 사람 앞에는 한 줄기 희망도 없었어.

en: In front of him was man.
ko: 그 사람 앞에 한 남자가 있었어.

en: You should better not smoke in his presence.
ko: 그 사람 앞에서는 담배 안 피우는 게 좋을 거야.

en: Don't talk about it in his presence.
ko: 그 사람 있는 데서 그 얘기 하지 마.

en: Don't talk about it in front of him.
ko: 그 사람 앞에서 그 얘기 하지 마.

en: His boat was washed ashore on a desert island.
ko: 그 사람 배가 무인도 해안으로 떠밀려 왔어.

en: His lack of technical knowledge precluded him from promotion.
ko: 기술 지식이 부족해서 승진을 못 했어.

en: His lack of technical knowledge kept him from being promoted.
ko: 전문 지식이 없어서 승진에서 밀렸어.

en: His ancestors went there from Ireland.
ko: 그 사람 조상들은 아일랜드에서 거기로 건너갔대.

en: Even his teacher didn't understand him.
ko: 선생님조차 그 사람을 이해 못 했어.

en: His constant efforts brought about peace.
ko: 그 사람의 끊임없는 노력이 평화를 가져왔어.

en: His continual boasting gave offense to everybody.
ko: 계속 자기 자랑을 늘어놔서 다들 불쾌해했어.

en: His constant insults aroused her anger.
ko: 계속 모욕하는 바람에 그 여자가 화가 났어.

en: His explanation is beside the point.
ko: 그 사람 설명은 핵심에서 벗어났어.

en: His explanation wasn't satisfying.
ko: 그 사람 설명은 만족스럽지 않았어.

en: His explanation is unconvincing.
ko: 그 사람 설명은 설득력이 없어.

en: His explanation was quite above me.
ko: 그 사람 설명은 내가 이해하기엔 너무 어려웠어.

en: What he said turned out to be false.
ko: 그 사람이 한 말은 거짓말로 드러났어.

en: His explanation didn't come across well.
ko: 그 사람 설명이 잘 전달되지 않았어.

en: His explanation doesn't make sense at all.
ko: 그 사람 설명은 도대체 말이 안 돼.

en: His explanation is not clear.
ko: 그 사람 설명은 명확하지가 않아.

en: His explanation is too obscure to understand.
ko: 설명이 너무 모호해서 이해하기 힘들어.

en: His explanation is far from satisfactory.
ko: 그 사람 설명은 만족스럽기엔 한참 멀었어.

en: Do you have anything to add to his explanation?
ko: 그 사람 설명에 더 보탤 거 있어?

en: His explanation cleared up the first problem, but I was still confused about the second.
ko: 첫 번째 문제는 설명 듣고 이해했는데, 두 번째 건 아직도 헷갈려.

en: His lecture is very long.
ko: 그 사람 강의 진짜 길어.

en: His lectures are very long.
ko: 그 사람 강의들은 다 너무 길어.

en: His explanation was too sketchy. I didn't understand it.
ko: 설명이 너무 대충이라 이해를 못 했어.

en: I'm fed up with him always preaching to me.
ko: 맨날 훈계질하는 거 진짜 지긋지긋해.

en: I'm tired of him bawling me out.

ko: 그 사람 새 책 덕분에 명성이 더 높아졌어.

en: His new book is going to come out next month.
ko: 그 사람 새 책 다음 달에 나온대.

en: His new secretary proved useless.
ko: 걔 새로 온 비서 진짜 쓸모없더라고.

en: His new white hat corresponds with his white jacket.
ko: 걔 새로 산 하얀 모자, 하얀 재킷이랑 잘 어울려.
